    • Method Detail

      • pushPlayer

        public void pushPlayer​(Player player,
                       QRCode[] qrCodes)
        Adds a player to the Firestore database with their email, phone number, and associated QR codes.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to add to the database
        qrCodes - an array of QRCode objects associated with the player

      • checkUserNameExist

        public void checkUserNameExist​(java.lang.String username,
                               OnCheckQRCodeExistListener onCheckQRCodeExistListener)
                        throws java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                               java.lang.InterruptedException
        Checks whether a given username exists in the Firestore database.
        Parameters:
        username - the username to check for existence
        onCheckQRCodeExistListener - an interface for listening to the result of the check
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - if the task executing the check fails
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread executing the check is interrupted

      • checkQRCodeExist

        public boolean checkQRCodeExist​(java.lang.String hashcode,
                                OnCheckQRCodeExistListener onCheckQRCodeExistListener)
                         throws java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                                java.lang.InterruptedException
        Checks whether a QR code with the given hash code exists in the database.
        Parameters:
        hashcode - the hash code of the QR code to check for existence
        onCheckQRCodeExistListener - the listener to handle the result of the check
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating whether the QR code exists in the database (may be inaccurate due to asynchronous behavior)
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - if the task fails due to an error
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the task is interrupted

      • pushQRCode

        public void pushQRCode​(QRCode qrCode,
                       double latitude,
                       double longitude)
        Adds a new QRCode to the Firestore database and stores its associated information, including score, location and comments.
        Parameters:
        qrCode - The QRCode object to be stored.
        latitude - The latitude coordinate of the QRCode's location.
        longitude - The longitude coordinate of the QRCode's location.

      • player_add_qrcode

        public void player_add_qrcode​(Player player,
                              java.lang.String hashcode)
        Adds a QR code to a player's collection of QR codes in the database.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to add the QR code to.
        hashcode - The hash code of the QR code to add.

      • qrcode_add_comment

        public void qrcode_add_comment​(QRCode qrCode,
                               java.lang.String comment)
        Adds a comment to a QRCode object in the database.
        Parameters:
        qrCode - the QRCode object to which the comment will be added
        comment - the comment to add to the QRCode object

      • delete_Players

        public void delete_Players​(Player player)
        Deletes a player's data from the database.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player object representing the player whose data will be deleted

      • delete_Player_QRCode

        public void delete_Player_QRCode​(Player player,
                                 QRCode qrCode)
        This method deletes the specified QR code from the player's collection of QR codes in the Firestore database.
        Parameters:
        player - the player object whose collection of QR codes will be updated
        qrCode - the QR code object to be deleted from the player's collection

      • getPlayer

        public void getPlayer​(java.lang.String playerName,
                      OnGetPlayerListener iquery)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Retrieves a player object from the database using their player name.
        Parameters:
        playerName - the name of the player to retrieve
        iquery - an instance of OnGetPlayerListener to handle the callback function when the player is successfully retrieved
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there is an error retrieving the player from the database

      • getQRCodesNum

        public int getQRCodesNum​(java.lang.String playerName,
                         OnQRCodeLengthComplete iquery)
        Returns the number of QR codes associated with a given player.
        Parameters:
        playerName - the name of the player to retrieve the QR code count for
        iquery - an OnQRCodeLengthComplete listener to handle the result
        Returns:
        the number of QR codes associated with the player

      • getQRCodeGeolocations

        public void getQRCodeGeolocations​(java.lang.String hashcode,
                                  OnGetQRCodeGeolocations iquery)
        Retrieves the geolocations of the QR code with the given hashcode.
        Parameters:
        hashcode - the hashcode of the QR code to retrieve the geolocations of
        iquery - an instance of OnGetQRCodeGeolocations that will be called upon completion of the retrieval

      • getQRCodeByName_hash

        public void getQRCodeByName_hash​(java.lang.String username,
                                 OnGetHashByUsernameListener iquery)
        Retrieves the hash codes of all QR codes belonging to a specific player.
        Parameters:
        username - the name of the player to retrieve the QR codes for
        iquery - an instance of OnGetHashByUsernameListener to handle the results of the query

      • getComments

        public void getComments​(java.lang.String hashcode,
                        OnGetCommentByHashListener iquery)
        Retrieves the comments associated with a QR code identified by its hash code.
        Parameters:
        hashcode - The hash code of the QR code to retrieve comments for.
        iquery - The callback interface to return the retrieved comments.

      • getQRCodeByName

        public void getQRCodeByName​(java.lang.String hashcode,
                            OnGetQRCodeListener iquery)
        Retrieves a QR code by its hashcode and its associated comments.
        Parameters:
        hashcode - the hashcode of the QR code to retrieve.
        iquery - the callback to handle the retrieved QR code.

      • getQRCodesByName

        public void getQRCodesByName​(java.lang.String username,
                             OnGetQRCodeNamesListener iquery)
        Retrieves an array of QR codes associated with a given username.
        Parameters:
        username - the username for which to retrieve the QR codes.
        iquery - an instance of OnGetQRCodeNamesListener to be called upon successful completion of the retrieval.

      • getAllQRCode

        public void getAllQRCode​(OnGetAllQRCodeListener iquery)
        This method retrieves all QR codes stored in the Firestore database and passes them to the listener
        Parameters:
        iquery - An instance of OnGetAllQRCodeListener interface, which will receive the list of QR codes.

                             OnGetPlayerQRCodesListener iquery)

        Parameters:
        iquery - An instance of OnGetPlayerQRCodesListener interface, which store the list of all player objects.
        playerName - player's name to be searched
